data.title: Top 100 Songs of the 1980s
data.meta_description: Did you enjoy this 1980 Music Through the Years Video above? Then be sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel to see all of our Top40Weekly videos!
data.text:
Did you enjoy this 1980 Music Through the Years Video above? Then be sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel to see all of our Top40Weekly videos!

The Top 100 songs of the 1980s, featuring timeless hits such as “Thriller,” “Beat It,” and “Billie Jean,” continue to resonate on radio waves today. This era introduced icons like Whitney Houston, Bruce Springsteen, and Madonna, who revolutionized the pop music landscape.

Here, we celebrate the best tunes of the 80s, a testament to a decade that forever altered the course of musical history.

Below are the Nolan Method Top 100 Songs of the 1980s. Depending on the decade, these charts are based on the best-selling and most popular songs played on Top 40 radio stations in the United States.

The chart is compiled based on airplay data submitted to Billboard by radio stations and later by sales of singles and then music downloads and streams.

The Nolan Method ranking system was formulated by lead Top40Weekly contributor Jarrett Nolan and is based on a point system for an artist’s chart performance the on Billboard Hot 100 Singles chart.

Be sure to check out our Year in Music snapshot of what was happening in the world of Top 40 music in this decade.

Written by radio and music industry veteran Ed Osborne, each overview highlights the important trends and some of the representative songs and artists that shaped the music landscape and occupied the Top 40 charts during this decade of music.

Also compiled under the Nolan method are the Top 100 Artists and Top 100 Albums of the 1980s. You can listen to all these great songs of the 1980s using our Spotify music player here: 1980s Playlists .

What was the biggest hit of the 1980s?

The biggest hit of the 1980s often sparks debates, but many agree that certain tracks stand out for their iconic status, sales, and airplay. This song is frequently listed among the “top 80s songs” and “most popular 80s songs,” reflecting its widespread acclaim and enduring popularity.

It epitomizes the vibrant music scene of the decade, capturing the essence of “80s music” and securing a place in the hearts of those who cherish the “best songs of the 80s.”

What songs were popular in the 80s?

Songs that were popular in the 80s encompass a wide range of genres, from “80s pop songs” to rock anthems, reflecting the era’s musical diversity. These tracks often appear in collections like “100 Hits of the 80s” and “80s Hits Songs,” highlighting the decade’s rich tapestry of sound.

The “80s songs list” is a testament to the period’s innovative and influential music, with “songs from the 80s” continuing to resonate with audiences worldwide.

What were the top 20 songs in 1980?

The top 20 songs in 1980 provided a snapshot of a dynamic year in music, contributing significantly to the “1980s songs” and setting the stage for the decade’s evolving soundscapes.

These hits, foundational to “1980 songs” compilations, also find their way into broader discussions about “80s top hits” and the “best 80s songs album songs,” illustrating the year’s impact on the broader musical canvas of the 80s.

What were the top songs of the 80s?

The top songs of the 80s, a blend of “80s hits” and timeless classics, showcase the decade’s unique musical contributions. This eclectic mix, often featured in “top 100 80s songs” and “popular songs from the 80s,” underscores the decade’s influence on future musical directions.

Whether through “80s music” compilations or “list of ’80s songs,” the era’s top tracks continue to captivate and inspire.
